assignments.description: Write the Boolean answer given by the user back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_Boolean_Answers_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Boolean Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the Date answer back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_Date_Answers_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Date Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the Date/Time answer back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow. Please note: the Field Service Mobile App unfortunately cannot save only the "Time" information, as the Time field is not available in Field Service Mobile Flows. Hence we use a "date/time" field and will then convert the value in a separate record triggered flow on the work step.
assignments.name: Assign_DateTime_Answers_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Date/Time Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Assign the "ParentId" (handed over automatically by the Field Service Mobile App) into a separate variable "var_WorkStep_Parent" before querying for any new work steps.
assignments.name: Assign_ParentId
assignments.label: Assign ParentId

assignments.description: Write the Picklist choice selected by the user back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_Picklist_Answer_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Picklist Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the Schedule Item Code Picklist choice selected by the user back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_ScheduleItemCode_Answer_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Schedule Item Code Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the "Schedule Item Code", the chosen "Answer" from the Picklist choice selected by the user and the Service Appointment Idtriggering this flow back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_SIC_SA_Answer_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Schedule Item Code, SA and Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the Answer Text String back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_Text_Answers_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Text Answer to Work Step

assignments.description: Write the Boolean answer to a question that included an external URL (e.g. work step in powerapps) given by the user back into the "Work Step" Variable prior to updating the record in the last step of this flow.
assignments.name: Assign_URL_Confirmation_Answers_to_Work_Step
assignments.label: Assign Answer given to URL Question to Work Step

assignments.description: Count the number of Work Steps still in the status "Open" as a validation prior to going into the loop element in the next step.
assignments.name: Assignment_CountOpenWorkSteps
assignments.label: Count open Work Steps

assignments.description: Increment the variable "var_OpenWorkSteps_Increment" by 1. Used to show the current position of each work step in the loop variable against the total number of open work steps.
assignments.name: Assignment_OpenWorkSteps_Increment
assignments.label: Increment Work Step Counter

assignments.description: When this flow is opened from a single "Work Step" (normally that would happen when users select single Work Steps from their work plan) instead of using the "Answer all open work steps" feature on mobile app, the total count of Work Steps is in this case manually set to "1" as the actual counting is skipped and otherwise the screen elements would not show the number of total answers correctly.
assignments.name: Assignment_Set_CountOpenWorkSteps_Variable
assignments.label: Set Count of open Work Steps Variable

choices.description: Choice used in the Work Step Entry Type "Boolean" as the "No" Option. Please Note: EAM requires the value to be sent as "N", hence this choice is of the type "Text" instead of being a true "boolean".
choices.name: ch_WS_Boolean_Answer_No

choices.description: Choice used in the Work Step Entry Type "Boolean" as the "Yes" Option. Please Note: EAM requires the value to be sent as "Y", hence this choice is of the type "Text" instead of being a true "boolean".
choices.name: ch_WS_Boolean_Answer_Yes

decisions.description: Determine whether any "Work Steps" (from Work Plans related to the Work Order or Child Work Order Line items) are still in an "Open" status prior to going into the loop element. If no Work Steps are still open, throw an error screen prompting the user to complete the work steps first.
decisions.name: Decision_CheckOpenWorkSteps
decisions.label: Check for Open Work Steps

decisions.description: Determine the "Entry Type" (e.g. string, boolean, date, URL etc.) of the Work Step that started this flow.
decisions.name: Decision_Determine_Work_Step_Entry_Type
decisions.label: Determine Work Step Entry Type

decisions.description:
Determine the Object Type of the Record Id triggering this flow. This is required to avoid having two flows to cater for the following scenarios: - The user only wants to answer one specific Work Step at this time and starts this flow from the "Work Plan" tab on the FSL Mobile App or Work Order Record on Desktop when selecting "Complete" on a single Work Step. - The user wants to answer all open Work Steps and enters this flow eg. through the "Update Status" flow on the FSL Mobile App and attempts to set a Service Appointment to "Complete" when Work Steps are still open.
In order to determine what object type the record Id is from, we find the Object type from the static "Record ID prefix" (first 3 digits of the ID) which is always the same on Standard objects: - For Service Appointment, the prefix is: 08p (this is handed over when a user enters this flow via e.g. the "Update Status" flow) - For "Work Step" objects the prefix is: 0hF (this is handed over when a user enters this flow via a single Work Step from their Work Plan
It was deliberately chosen to use those static/hardcoded prefixes for the decision outcomes as it only needs to cater to the above 2 cases and respect especially the Field Service Mobile App limitations in regards FSL Mobile Flow capabilities - even though it might not be best practice in general to use hardcoded elements.
decisions.name: Decision_DetermineObjectType
decisions.label: Determine object type of Record Id

decisions.description:
Determine the Object Type of the Parent Record Id triggering this flow. This is required to avoid having two flows to cater for the following scenarios: 1) The "Complete All Open Work Steps" flow was launched from a Service Appointment that is related to a "Work Order" 2) OR The "Complete All Open Work Steps" flow was launched from a Service Appointment that is related to a "Work Order Line Item"
In order to determine what object type the record Id is from, we find the Object type from the static "Record ID prefix" (first 3 digits of the ID) which is always the same on Standard objects: - For "Work Order" objects the prefix is: 0WO - For "Work Order Line Items" objects the prefix is: 1WL
It was deliberately chosen to use those static/hardcoded prefixes for the decision outcomes as it only needs to cater to the above 2 cases and respect especially the Field Service Mobile App limitations in regards FSL Mobile Flow capabilities - even though it might not be best practice in general to use hardcoded elements.
decisions.name: Decision_DetermineObjectType_ParentRecord
decisions.label: Determine Object Type of Parent Record

decisions.description: Determine whether the Work Step Record has the field "WorkOrderLineItemID" populated. If yes, continue
decisions.name: Decision_Is_WorkStep_Parent_WorkOrder_or_WOLI
decisions.label: Is Work Step Parent Work Order or WOLI?
decisions.defaultConnectorLabel: Error - Work Step not linked to WO or WOLI

decisions.description: If the checkbox "Is Mandatory" on the Work Step Record is "true", AND the lenghts of the variable "var_WorkStepRecord_Single>MSN_WorkStep_Answer" is < 1, throw an error screen and prompt the user to go back to answer the question.
decisions.name: Decision_IsMandatoryWorkStepBlank
decisions.label: Is mandatory Work Step answer empty?

decisions.description: This decision caters for the usecase, that a "Work Step" could also be completed from Salesforce Desktop (e.g. by a Job Coordinator) and not only from the Field Service Mobile App. It checks, whether the flow was opened from the Field Service Mobile App or from Desktop in order to complete the Work Step Question. If the variable "Id" is filled it is opened from the Mobile App, if the variable "recordId" is filled, then it was opened from Desktop and then populates the "Id" variable to lookup the correct Work Step in the next step.
decisions.name: Decision_OpenedFromMobileOrDesktop
decisions.label: Opened from FSL Mobile App or Desktop?

decisions.description: Check if the "ParentId" variable is empty. Usually that only happens when this flow is opened from Desktop. If so, then retrieve the Parent Record of the Service Appointment with the next get element, otherwise directly jump to the next decision element.
decisions.name: Decision_ParentId_empty
decisions.label: ParentId empty?

decisions.description:
Determine the Object Type of the Record Id triggering this flow. This is required to avoid issues with the following scenarios: - The user only wants to answer one specific Schedule item Code Work Step at this time and starts this flow from the "Work Plan" tab on the FSL Mobile App or Work Order Record on Desktop when selecting "Complete" on a single Work Step. - The user wants to answer all open Work Steps and enters this flow eg. through the "Update Status" flow on the FSL Mobile App and attempts to set a Service Appointment to "Complete" when Work Steps are still open.
In order to determine what object type the record Id is from, we find the Object type from the static "Record ID prefix" (first 3 digits of the ID) which is always the same on Standard objects: - For Service Appointment, the prefix is: 08p (this is handed over when a user enters this flow via e.g. the "Update Status" flow) - For "Work Step" objects the prefix is: 0hF (this is handed over when a user enters this flow via a single Work Step from their Work Plan
It was deliberately chosen to use those static/hardcoded prefixes for the decision outcomes as it only needs to cater to the above 2 cases and respect especially the Field Service Mobile App limitations in regards FSL Mobile Flow capabilities - even though it might not be best practice in general to use hardcoded elements.
decisions.name: Decision_SIC_DetermineObjectType
decisions.label: Determine object type of Record Id

Flow.description: 19/01/2022 - Version 1: Cloned from existing Flow "MSN - Field Service Mobile App - Complete All Open Work Steps" as a POC to show that it would be possible to call this flow as a subflow from the "Work Complete Review" flow and reuse it to update Work Steps

dynamicChoiceSets.description: Get the possible answers from the related "Work Step Answers" of this Work Step. This is used in Work Steps of the type "Picklist" only.
dynamicChoiceSets.name: choiceSet_WorkStepAnswers_Picklist

dynamicChoiceSets.description: Get the possible answers from the object "Allowed Schedule Items" related to the Work Type of the Service appointment triggering this flow. This is used in Work Steps of the type "Schedule Item Code" only.
dynamicChoiceSets.name: choiceSet_WorkStepAnswers_ScheduleItemCode

Flow.interviewLabel: TEST - MSN - Work Steps- Complete All Open Work Steps - Desktop {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}
Flow.label: TEST - MSN - Work Steps- Complete All Open Work Steps - Desktop

loops.description: Loop through all open Work Steps stored in the variable "var_WorkStepRecords_Collection"
loops.name: Loop_OverOpenWorkStepRecords
loops.label: Loop over open Work Step Records

recordLookups.description: Lookup records details from the Service Appointment triggering this flow in order to retrieve its Parent Record Id (which can be either a WO or WOLI). The SA Record Id is handed over by the Field Service Lightning App into the Variable "Id" or by Salesforce (Desktop) Flows into the variable "recordId".
recordLookups.name: Get_Service_Appointment_Details
recordLookups.label: Get Parent Record ID from Service Appointment

recordLookups.description: Lookup all record details for the current "Work Step" that launched this flow.
recordLookups.name: Get_Single_WorkStep
recordLookups.label: Get Single Work Step

recordLookups.description: Lookup all open "Work Steps" related to the Parent Work order of the Service Appointment triggering this flow.
recordLookups.name: Get_Work_Step_Details_WO
recordLookups.label: Get All Open Work Steps - WO

recordLookups.description: Lookup all open "Work Steps" related to the Parent Work Order Line Item of the Service Appointment triggering this flow.
recordLookups.name: Get_Work_Step_Details_WOLI
recordLookups.label: Get All Open Work Steps - WOLI

recordLookups.description: Lookup records details from the parent Work Order Line Item Record of the Work Step triggering this flow in order to retrieve its Work Type. This will be used for Work Steps of the type "Schedule Item Code" in order to retrieve all "Allowed Schedule Items" from the Work Type in order to present the user a dynamic picklist of allowed choices to choose from.
recordLookups.name: Get_Work_Type_Details_from_parent_WOLI
recordLookups.label: Get Work Type Details from parent Work Order Line Item

recordLookups.description: Lookup records details from the parent Work Order Record of the Work Step triggering this flow in order to retrieve its Work Type. This will be used for Work Steps of the type "Schedule Item Code" in order to retrieve all "Allowed Schedule Items" from the Work Type in order to present the user a dynamic picklist of allowed choices to choose from.
recordLookups.name: Get_Work_Type_Details_from_parent_Work_Order
recordLookups.label: Get Work Type Details from parent Work Order

recordUpdates.description: Update the "Work Step" record that currently is processed in this loop with new values set by the assignment elements. Important Note: against best practice to have an "Update Records" element inside a loop, it was deliberately decided to place it inside in this particular case, as user entry happens rather slow after each other on each screen and the Field Service mobile app needs significantly longer to sync back the changes to Salesforce. So it was deemed safe and beneficial to immediately update each work step in Salesforce while the user is still working on the flow, as this also is then timely showing the progress with the "Work Plan" in Salesforce (e.g. to a Job Coordinator) without having to fear hitting governor limits while looping over each open work step.
recordUpdates.name: MSN_Update_Work_Step_Record
recordUpdates.label: Update Work Step Record

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case neither of the two outcome decisions "Open Work Steps" or "No Open Work Steps" could be executed.
screens.name: Screen_CannotDetermineOpenWorkStepCount
screens.label: Cannot determine open Work Steps

fields.name: Screen_WS_NoRecordId_Error_Message_0_0
fields.fieldText:
Awww, Snap! We hit a snag.


It looks like we couldn't determine if there are any open Work Steps left on your Work Plan for this job.


Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case the decision cannot determine what Object type the Record ID in the "Id" variable is of. (Has to be either Service Appointment or Work Step)
screens.name: Screen_UnknownObjectType
screens.label: Unidentified Object Type

fields.name: Screen_UnknownObjectType_ErrorMessage
fields.fieldText:
Awww, Snap! We hit a snag.


It looks like we cannot determine from which record you attempted to open this feature from.


Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "Boolean" (Yes or No)
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_Boolean_Screen_0
screens.label: Please confirm the question below

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "Date"
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_Date_Screen
screens.label: Please select a date

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "Date/Time"
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_DateTime
screens.label: Please select a date and time

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "String"
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_Picklist_Screen
screens.label: Please enter your answer below

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "Schedule Item Code" (aka "RFP Code")
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_ScheduleItemCode_Screen
screens.label: Please enter your answer below

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to enter an answer for a "Work Step" of the entry type "String"
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_String_Screen
screens.label: Please enter your answer below

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to confirm that they completed a workstep outside of the FSL app by following a URL to an external website (e.g. Powerapps)
screens.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_URL_Screen
screens.label: Please confirm the question below

fields.name: Screen_WS_EntryType_URL_WorkStep_Question
fields.fieldText:
{!var_WorkStepRecord_Single.Description}

Open external app

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case no answer has been given or selected on the previous screens.
screens.name: Screen_WS_MandatoryAnswerIsBlank
screens.label: No answer given

fields.name: Screen_WS_MandatoryAnswerIsBlank_ErrorText
fields.fieldText:
Error - no answer given.


This Work Step requires an answer. Please navigate back and type in or select an answer accordingly.

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case the Work Step is not related to a WO or WOLI Record.
screens.name: Screen_WS_NoParentRecord
screens.label: No Parent Record

fields.name: Screen_WS_NoParentRecord_Error_Message
fields.fieldText:
Awww, Snap! We hit a snag.


It looks like your Work Step record is not related to a Work Order or Work Order Line Item - which is compulsory to continue.


Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case no Record ID is populated in either the "ID" variable or "recordID" variable.
screens.name: Screen_WS_NoRecordId
screens.label: No Record Id

fields.name: Screen_WS_NoRecordId_Error_Message
fields.fieldText:
Awww, Snap! We hit a snag.


It looks like there was no Record ID prepopulated for this Work Step when opening this feature.


Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case no Record ID is populated in either the "ID" variable or "recordID" variable.
screens.name: Screen_WS_NoRecordId_0
screens.label: No Record Id

fields.name: Screen_WS_NoRecordId_Error_Message_0_0_0
fields.fieldText:
Awww, Snap! We hit a snag.


It looks like there was no Record ID prepopulated for this Work Step when opening this feature.


Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

screens.description: Shows an Error Message to the user in case the "Entry Type" of the Work Step is not one of the other scenarios (string, date, boolean). In this case, new scenarios will have to be added to this flows decision element.
screens.name: Screen_WS_Unknown_Entry_Type
screens.label: Unknown Answer Type

fields.name: Screen_WS_Status_Error_Message
fields.fieldText:
Error - Unknown Answer Type


It looks like this Work Step requires you to enter an answer type that is not yet supported.

Please get in touch with your friendly Salesforce Support team and make them aware of this error.

variables.description: Stores the Record ID of the record that triggered this flow. In this case the Service Appointment ID. This is handed over from the FSL Mobile App into the flow.
variables.name: Id

variables.description: Stores the ParentRecord ID of the record that triggered this flow (usually the Work Order Id of the Service Appointment). This is handed over from the FSL Mobile App into the flow.
variables.name: ParentId

variables.description: Used to store the Record ID of the "Work Step" template, when the flow is opened from a Desktop Device
variables.name: recordId

variables.description: Stores the "Activity Code Name" of the Work Type the current Service Appointment/Parent Work Order has. This is used in the next "Select Schedule Item Code" screen to show the user, which Activity Code the Schedule Item relates to.
variables.name: var_Current_WorkType_ActivityCode

variables.description: Stores the Record Id of the Work Type the current Service Appointment/Parent Work Order has. This is then used later in order to look up all possible "Schedule Item Codes" allowed for that specific work types, when users have a Work Step of the Type "Schedule Item Code" and are supposed to pick an option from the dynamic picklist relevant to their current job.
variables.name: var_Current_WorkType_Id

variables.description: Used to assign each element in the loop an incrementing number starting from 1 and then counting up depending on how many items are in the loop. This is used on each screen within the loop to give the user an indication of how many questions already have been completed from the total number.
variables.name: var_OpenWorkSteps_Increment

variables.description: Counts the total number of Work Steps that are still open. Used in the decision "determine open work steps" as a precheck if any Work Steps are still open and also to show the user the total number of questions that need answering on each flow screen.
variables.name: var_OpenWorkSteps_TotalCount

variables.description: Used to separately store the Parent ID (either Work Order or Work Order Line Item) as the Field Service Mobile App experienced problems using the normal 'ParentId' variable and tried to revert to the cache instead of querying new records from Salesforce.
variables.name: var_WorkStep_ParentID

variables.description: Stores the looked-up record details from the "Work Step" that triggered this flow.
variables.name: var_WorkStepRecord_Single

variables.description: Stores all looked-up Work Step records related to the Parent Work Order of the Service Appointment that triggered this flow.
variables.name: var_WorkStepRecords_Collection
